result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monte Reginald Mabra

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monte Reginald Mabra appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle appeared by video for Monte Reginald Mabra.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defendant is reminded of the no contact order and encouraged to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-10-2022
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Pat Earle in PE court requesting an adjourned hearing. Parties notified of new court date.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Continuance.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086220,
Payable Number: 1031144,
Receipt Number: 22RP036246,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 3 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TSV. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Monte Reginald Mabra in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Monte Reginald Mabra.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 1:30p
